intro: Drosanthemum edwardsiae, commonly known as the Cape tulip, is a flowering plant native to South Africa. It belongs to the Aizoaceae family, known for its succulent characteristics and ability to thrive in arid environments. The plant features upright stems with clustered, showy flowers that range in color from yellow to orange. Its foliage is typically fleshy and gray-green, adapted to store water. Drosanthemum edwardsiae is often grown as an ornamental plant for its vibrant blooms and drought tolerance.
